PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: A. Owens, 3550 Camp Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 18, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that refuse drivers and collectors should be tipped at Christmas time? Is service affected if they are not?" answer reads: "Yes, they should, because they do nice things that they don't have to do, like picking up rubbish, cans, ashes, leaves, trees, wood and other refuse.  I don't think it affects the service whether or not the refuse collectors receive tips."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of A. Owens wearing dark hat, coat with diamond pattern around edges, and holding paper grocery bag and dark handbag, standing on sidewalk in front of store window with sign that reads "Lady... Ice Cream..."
